Founder InvestorsHospitality education. Reimagined.

The people that helped make the Indian School of Hospitality possible

In order to bring an international standard of hospitality education to India, ISH has entered an academic partnership with global hospitality education leader Ecole hoterliere de Lausanne. Established in 1893, École hôtelière de Lausanne has since become synonymous with world class education. Located in Le Chalet-a-Gobet, the school has a student body of over 2600 students of 107 nationalities, and boasts an extensive alumni network.



Gaurav Bhalla

Gaurav Bhalla
Managing Director,  Vatika Hospitality

Managing Director of Vatika Hospitality, Gaurav has over 16 years of experience in the real estate, hospitality and F&B business.

Gaurav spearheads the hotels, restaurants, business centres, facilities and QSR businesses of the Vatika Group. He holds a Master’s Degree in Business Management from the University of Buckingham and a Diploma in Business Management from Harvard University.

Aditya Rajaram

Aditya Rajaram
Managing Director at Radar  DWC LLC/Aloft 

Aditya K. Rajaram is the Managing Director of Radar Holdings, a hospitality development enterprise.

Rajaram has previously worked with Ernst & Young in their specialised hospitality, real estate and finance team. Rajaram has also worked on various operator search and selections for hotel projects in Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and the UAE, in addition to creating a comprehensive strategic hotel investment and development strategy for a mega real estate company in Dubai. A graduate from Cornell University’s School of Hotel Administration, he is an active member of the Cornell Hotel Society – Arabian Gulf Chapter and the Penn State Hotel Restaurant Society.

Dhairya Choudhrie

Dhairya Choudhrie
Managing Director,  Shanti Hospitality 

Dhairya Choudhrie is the Managing Director of Shanti Hospitality, which owns seventeen operational hotels globally, including the Ananda Spa and a portfolio of Hyatt hotels in India.

Earlier in his career, he was instrumental in the sale of Grandeur Real Estate to Alpha G: Corp working with Morgan Stanley. He was also part of the team that grew BIG Malls India with a $32m investment from Silverpeak Asset Management. Dhairya is a graduate in Economics and Business Management from Boston’s North Eastern University.

Amit Bhosale

Amit Bhosale
Managing Director of the ABIL Group

As the Managing Director of the ABIL Group (Avinash Bhosale Group), Mr. Amit Bhosale has spearheaded multiple luxury real estate projects. He has established ABIL Group as a leading luxury real estate developer in Pune’s luxury real estate landscape, and, with a strong academic and professional background, Mr. Bhosale brings a fresh and unique perspective in understanding the premium real estate culture to India.

He completed his Bachelors in Commerce from Symbiosis Institute, Pune, after which he pursued his Masters in Hospitality Management from Les Roches, Switzerland. Mr. Bhosale also further successfully completed the Owners/President Management Program from Harvard Business School.

The ABIL group ventured into the world of hospitality with the first project being the Hotel Sun-n-Sand in Pune. Under the aegis of Mr. Avinash Bhosale, Mr. Amit Bhosale has taken forward the real estate legacy into a new level of experience in hospitality. Passionate about hospitality, he has successfully set up the St. Regis Hotel in Mumbai; The Westin Hotel in Pune; Le Meridien in Nagpur and W Resorts and Spa in Goa.

Rajesh Advani

Rajesh Advani
Director F2 Fun & Fitness

On graduation with a Masters in Hospitality Management from Cornell University in 1996, Rajesh, a second-generation entrepreneur, took over as head of the Sun-n-Sand Group. He brings with him his association with the hospitality field and heads the group with a view to consolidate its brand strength.

Dhruv Sharma

Dhruv Sharma
Founder, Guesthouser

Patu Keswani

Patu Keswani
Chairman and Managing Director of Lemon Tree Hotels

Patu Keswani is the chairman and managing director of one of the fastest growing hotel chains in India, Lemon Tree Hotels Pvt Ltd. He is a maverick entrepreneur and an involved angel investor in housing and vocational training, and a promotor of social responsibility and welfare.

An alumnus of IIT Delhi and IIM Kolkata, Patu began his career with the TATA Group, working under the Taj Hotels umbrella, of which he would eventually become Senior Vice President. Almost two decades later, he joined A T Kearney, a leading global management consulting firm.

With his strategic insight in the hospitality industry, Patu identified the gap for midmarket and economy hotels within India, and set up his independent venture- Lemon Tree Hotels in 2002. From the first hotel in Gurgaon in 2004, Lemon Tree Hotels is now India’s fourth largest hospitality group, with 43 hotels and 4500 rooms across India, with plans to expand to 8000 rooms by 2018.

Lemon Tree Hotels are strong promotors of corporate social responsibility, providing equal employment opportunities for the differently abled, as well as encouraging animal rights and welfare.

Amit Bhosale

Amit Bhosale
Managing Director of the ABIL Group

As the Managing Director of the ABIL Group (Avinash Bhosale Group), Mr. Amit Bhosale has spearheaded multiple luxury real estate projects. He has established ABIL Group as a leading luxury real estate developer in Pune’s luxury real estate landscape, and, with a strong academic and professional background, Mr. Bhosale brings a fresh and unique perspective in understanding the premium real estate culture to India.

He completed his Bachelors in Commerce from Symbiosis Institute, Pune, after which he pursued his Masters in Hospitality Management from Les Roches, Switzerland. Mr. Bhosale also further successfully completed the Owners/President Management Program from Harvard Business School.

The ABIL group ventured into the world of hospitality with the first project being the Hotel Sun-n-Sand in Pune. Under the aegis of Mr. Avinash Bhosale, Mr. Amit Bhosale has taken forward the real estate legacy into a new level of experience in hospitality. Passionate about hospitality, he has successfully set up the St. Regis Hotel in Mumbai; The Westin Hotel in Pune; Le Meridien in Nagpur and W Resorts and Spa in Goa.

Sonny Iqbal

Sonny Iqbal
Consultant and Global Co-Leader Family Business Practice at Egon Zehnder

Sonny Iqbal began his career with Egon Zehnder in their London office in 1998, before relocating to India and setting up a practice for the firm with offices in New Delhi, Bangalore and Mumbai.

Sonny brings extensive experience of working with senior level executives and Board members in companies ranging in size from venture-capital-backed start-ups to multi-billion-dollar multi-national corporations across geographies and markets. He focuses on senior level Executive Search and Talent Management work. He also works with private equity firms on portfolio company CEO and board searches.

Sonny is the co-leader of Egon Zehnder’s Global Family Business Advisory, counselling family businesses on succession, founder transition, governance and developing a family charter. He also coaches senior executives and family members. Widely experienced across sectors he has been anchored in Life Sciences, Consumer and the Assessment & Development Practices. Sonny speaks and writes frequently on matters relating to Family Business and dynamics within Owner Families.

Prior to joining Egon Zehnder International in 1998, Sonny worked in Operations and Marketing at The Oberoi Group based in the UK. He also worked with Oberoi in India & the Middle East. Subsequently he worked at American Express where he led the Financial and Travel Services Business in India.

Jaideep Vohra

Jaideep Vohra
Managing Director, Sarova Hotels

Jaideep Singh Vohra is a third generation Kenyan-Indian hotelier and businessman, based in Nairobi, Kenya.

With over 37 years of experience in the tourism and hospitality industries, JS is Group CEO & MD of Sarova Hotels Ltd, one of Kenya’s largest privately owned hotel groups. The portfolio includes unique and distinct award winning urban hotels, resorts and safari lodges. Sarova Hotels was recently awarded as Africa’s Leading Hotel Brand at the just concluded 2017 World Travel Awards.

JS is also the Chairman of Kenya Association of Hotelkeepers & Caterers, immediate past Chair, Kenya Motor Sports Federation and plays an active role as an owner of the East African Safari Classic Rally.
